body.name: Alexander Hamilton: The Graphic History of an American Founding Father
body.merchantInfo: Sold by FindAnyBook and Fulfilled by Amazon.
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews Review Selected for the American Library Association's 2018 Great Graphic Novels for Teens"There’s loads to be learned here, and any Hamilton addict willeagerly eat it up. . .worthy of high praise." —Booklist". . . a timely portrait of the famous and controversial Alexander Hamilton." —Library Journal (Genre Spotlight: Graphic Novels)"For fans of the stage show who are looking to dive deeper into the real history that inspired it, Alexander Hamilton: The Graphic History Of An American Founding Father is just what you need on your TBR." —Bustle"Unpacking the history behind the high-energy Broadway megahit Hamilton, this focused biography will get teen through adult readers to ask questions about the country’s past and present."—Library Journal (Review)Advance praise for Alexander Hamilton:"Yo, yo, yo, check out this bookIt’s amazing and cool and has a baller look.Get on down to an LCS in your neighborhoodHave your mind blown by Hennessey / Greenwood.This ain’t no U.S. propaganda It’s the best Hamilton since L.M. Miranda." —Marc Guggenheim, co-creator of Arrow and Legends of Tomorrow, screenwriter, producer, and comic book writer"Cramming an entire life into a single graphic novel—especially a life as full as Hamilton's—is no mean feat, but Hennessey is up to the task. Greenwood's engaging art, aided by Simpson's color, brings the pages to life with a vibrant energy."—Antony Johnston, writer of Atomic Blonde, The Fuse, and Julius"This book needs to be in schools and on your shelves. Hennessey knows his Hamilton history and Greenwood’s art has a pulse that makes the founder's story as compelling for comics as it is for great theatre." —Jeff Parker, writer of Future Quest and Batman ‘66 About the Author JONATHAN HENNESSEY is the author of three previous nonfiction graphic novels, The United States Constitution, The Gettysburg Address, The Comic Book Story of Beer, and The Comic Book Story of Video Games. He is also the writer of the history-based time travel series Epochalypse. Based in Los Angeles, he works in film and television. JUSTIN GREENWOOD is a Bay Area-based comic book illustrator known for his work on creator-owned comic book series like The Fuse, Stumptown, Wasteland, and Resurrection.

body.description: A graphic novel biography of the American legend who inspired the hit Broadway musical Hamilton. Alexander Hamilton was one of the most influential figures in United States history—he fought in the Revolutionary War, helped develop the Constitution, and as the first Secretary of the Treasury established landmark economic policy that we still use today. Cut down by a bullet from political rival Aaron Burr, Hamilton has since been immortalized alongside other Founding Fathers such as George Washington and Thomas Jefferson—his likeness even appears on the ten-dollar bill. In this fully-illustrated and impeccably researched graphic novel-style history, author Jonathan Hennessey and comic book illustrator Justin Greenwood bring Alexander Hamilton’s world to life, telling the story of this improbable hero who helped shape the United States of America. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Go see it
reviews.reviewText: Amazing. Would see it again. I only wish I had known more of the story and songs- rather than now when the songs won’t leave my mind - what an amazing show to be entirely in song. I didn’t think that would be my thing,. My 11-year-old and 13-year-old loved it, this was my 11-year-old dream to see the show. I am thinking about going to see it in New York with her ! You can show up last minute and get seats for much cheaper we found out. But why risk it?!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great telling of a classic American life.
reviews.reviewText: A great telling of the tale of Alexander Hamilton with a more accurate and insightful take on his life than the uber popular musical. Fans of the musical looking for a bit more history and a little less embellishment without a history book feel will love this adaptation. The real story doesn't match musical fiction and while the life of someone like Hamilton can never entirely fit into a graphic novel, this one hits the right high points and captures the essence of the man along with great art.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Postal service, worth the waiting.
reviews.reviewText: Thanks to the pandemic, the package was in two months late, but worth the waiting. When I get in contact with the seller, they were absolutely helpful. Now it's finally arrived, and absolutely intact.Thank you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good book/poorly put together.
reviews.reviewText: My son in middle school is going a summer reading challenge for school. We picked out this book as it was of interest to him. A couple days later, the binding became unglued. Nothing we can’t fix but it upset him. So I’d give it 5 stars if it weren’t for that!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars He appeared to be very happy with the gift
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this book after seeing it in a museum in Rhode Island. My son is fascinated with anything Alexander Hamilton related. He appeared to be very happy with the gift. The storyline, the artistry and the inking we're well done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great illustrations and design
reviews.reviewText: Great illustrations and design. Very well done.It's a lot more accessible for teens than a regular history textbook would be. It's not meant for a research paper, obviously, but its great at giving important background information.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My first Graphic novel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Hamilton - an education
reviews.reviewText: A creative and educational graphic novel, Alexander Hamilton: The Graphic History of An American Founding Father presents an interesting look at this enigmatic figure who helped shape the nation. The book follows the life of Alexander Hamilton from his days as a clerk in St. Croix to his joining of the American Revolution to his service as Secretary of Treasury. It also covers his private and public scandals, from his extramarital affair to his duel with Aaron Burr. However, it takes a while to get into as there’s some confusing time-jumping in the beginning. And at times author Jonathan Hennessey tries to cram in too much information and a biblical allegory that doesn’t really advance the plot. Also, the artwork by Justin Greenwood is pretty bland and some of the characters are indistinguishable from each other. Still, the panel layouts are rather creative and there’s some nice texture to the backgrounds. Alexander Hamilton: The Graphic History of An American Founding Father has some problems, but overall it’s an impressive biography.

reviews.reviewTitle: Può essere usato per qualsiasi cosa! Ad esempio per disegnare ecc.
